screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .xcworkspace file in Apple Xcode 14
screenshot.caption: XCWORKSPACE file open in Apple Xcode 14

description: Apple Xcode is a free IDE for developers to build software for various Apple platforms, including iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS. The IDE includes many tools for building, testing, deploying, and reviewing user feedback regarding apps.

You can create an XCWORKSPACE file from scratch by selecting File → New → Workspace . You can also create an XCWORKSPACE file from an open project by selecting File → Save As Workspace... . Additionally, when you create an XCODEPROJ file, Xcode automatically creates an XCWORKSPACE file and saves it in the XCODEPROJ file (also a macOS package).
